Comment: America, in its founding lore, was a place to go when your home was no longer tolerant of your way of life. Growing up in America we were taught that the pilgrims came here to feel religious persecution. That we threw England out for the promise of a Democratic Republic. That we fought and won civil war to free the slaves and preserve the Union. We got involved in two World Wars to usher in the end of Imperialism and save Europe from tyranny. And all along the way we welcomed in the tired, the hungry, and the huddled masses. America was the Land of Opportunity. All men created equal.  It was, of course, far more nuanced than that. But that was our LORE. Our identity. What we strived to be. And even went we faltered and failed, we looked to that ideal, that promise and as a nation tried to be more than what we really are.   We have been on this dark road before. There is a way out. But we need to remember that the Idea of America, and who she really is, are two different entities all together. This blight of xenophobia and hate has ALWAYS been in America. We just never projected it so loudly and boldly before.   We cannot let this hate stand without a fight.
